During a conversation with a prospective customer in the High Tech industry, you can ask exploratory questions to learn more about their business and how it relates to the challenges of financial planning and analysis, and add a clarifying statement after each question that states what is typically seen in other high tech businesses with the same challenges. Some examples include:

1. How do you currently forecast your revenue and profits? (Typically, High Tech businesses have a hard time forecasting future revenue and profits due to the rapidly changing market and the need to constantly innovate)
2. What are some of the biggest challenges you face when it comes to valuing your intangible assets? (Typically, High Tech companies have trouble valuing intangible assets such as intellectual property and brand value due to the lack of standard methods for valuing these assets)
3. How do you balance short-term financial goals with long-term strategic investments? (Typically, High Tech companies are under pressure to meet short-term financial goals while also investing in long-term strategic initiatives such as research and development)
4. How do you maintain the required level of liquidity for your business? (Typically, High Tech companies need to maintain high levels of liquidity in order to fund research and development and capitalize on new opportunities)
5. How do you manage and allocate resources across multiple projects and product lines? (Typically, High Tech companies have multiple projects and product lines, which can make it difficult to manage and allocate resources effectively)
6. How do you measure the financial performance of your business? (Typically, the unique nature of the High Tech industry can make it difficult to measure financial performance using traditional metrics)
7. How do you maintain profitability in the face of intense competition and rapid technological change? (Typically, maintaining profitability in the high tech industry is challenging due to intense competition and rapid technological change)
8. How do you currently handle the scalability and integration of your financial systems? (Typically, High Tech companies have large amounts of data to handle and need to have integration with other financial systems to consolidate and analyze financial data)

Asking these questions and making these clarifying statements will help you to understand the customer's specific challenges and needs, and will help you to position your product or service as a solution that addresses those challenges.
